verbose_text: Using the premises that " serum deprivation procedure has been used in various experimental models to induce neuronal death " and " serum withdrawal reduces the levels of neurotrophins and antioxidants in the extracellular medium which eventually leads cells to " starve " from these neurotrophic factors, " Kang and colleagues presented the beneficial actions of sulbutiamine in serum deprived transformed retinal ganglion cells [XREF_BIBR].
